February 27 at 2:27 PM ·

Last night, the City of Claremont and Claremont Unified School District hosted the award reception for the 30th Annual Making Change Contest. This contest is an opportunity for students to honor and remember advocates of social change. Claremont students submitted individual letters, essays, multimedia presentations, or artistic pieces completed as a group. At the reception, students presented their winning art entries and essays, and were awarded with certificates from City Council and CUSD School Board. Thank you again to the hundreds of students who participated in the contest, and congratulations to our winners!

Individual Winners:
Ingo Ellwanger - 3rd/4th grade
Ginger Mungaray - 5th/6th grade
Dominick Yacoub - 7th/8th grade
Jacob Previch - 9th/10th grade
Marvin Matamala - 9th/10th grade
